Question 1.question: Which of the following is true about Class Diagram?
Question 1.answer_a: Class Diagram must contain name, attribute, and operation methods of the class
Question 1.answer_b: Class Diagram represents the structure of the system
Question 1.answer_c: There is generally no relationship between different classes
Question 1.answer_d: Class diagram must be the first step when doing Requirement Elicitation

Question 2.question: What is 'aggregation' in a class relationship?
Question 2.answer_a: It is considered 'part of' relationship and is symbolized by a clear white diamond
Question 2.answer_b: It is considered 'entirely made of' relationship and is symbolized by a clear white diamond
Question 2.answer_c: It is considered 'entirely made of' relationship and is symbolized by black diamond
Question 2.answer_d: It is considered 'part of' relationship and is symbolized by a black diamond

Question 3.question: What is 'dependency' in a class relationship?
Question 3.answer_a: It is symbolized by solid line with black arrow
Question 3.answer_b: It is symbolized by dashed line with white arrow
Question 3.answer_c: It is symbolized by solid line with white arrow
Question 3.answer_d: It is symbolized by dotted line

Question 5.question: What is the heuristic which the sequence diagram follows?
Question 5.answer_a: The message arrow in sequence diagram go from left to right and is read from bottom to top
Question 5.answer_b: The sequence diagram must follow the order of events in the use case description
Question 5.answer_c: Position the lifelines to make message arrows as short as possible

Question 6.question: The order of events in a sequence diagram is determined:
Question 6.answer_a: By following the order of events in the use case description
Question 6.answer_b: By placing numbers in comments along the left-hand margin of the diagram
Question 6.answer_c: By the relative position of the events on the timeline
Question 6.answer_d: By the sequence numbers of the events

Question 7.question: Which of the following is true about sequence diagram?
Question 7.answer_a: The messages in the sequence diagram must be synchronous
Question 7.answer_b: Activation are represented by dashed lines
Question 7.answer_c: Lifelines are represented by narrow bars
Question 7.answer_d: Objects can be represented using rectangles or stereotypes

Question 9.question: What is 'aggregation' in a class relationship?
Question 9.answer_a: It is symbolized by a white triangle
Question 9.answer_b: It is symbolized by a black triangle
Question 9.answer_c: It is symbolized by a white diamond
Question 9.answer_d: It is symbolized by a black diamond

Question 11.question: How are objects represented in a sequence diagram?

Question 12.question: Which is true about sequence diagrams?
Question 12.answer_a: Sequence diagrams are good at precise definition of single object in many use cases
Question 12.answer_b: Sequence diagrams are good at capturing interactions between objects
Question 12.answer_c: Sequence diagrams are good at precise definition of many use cases and many threads
Question 12.answer_d: Sequence diagrams is a conceptual model
